comment.text: This translation key is used to display an error message indicating that a domain entered is incorrect. It is commonly displayed in a dialog or notification when a user attempts to access a trusted mail account with an invalid domain. The translated version of this message should appear next to "Incorrect domain" on the screen.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The French translation 'Domaine incorrecte' is grammatically incorrect. 'Domaine' is masculine, so the adjective 'incorrecte' should be 'incorrect'.

The translation "유효하지 않은 도메인입니다" (yu-hyo-ha-ji a-neun do-mein-im-ni-da) literally translates to "It is an invalid domain." While understandable, a more natural and nuanced translation of "Incorrect domain" might be "잘못된 도메인입니다" (jal-mot-deun do-mein-im-ni-da) which means "It is a wrong/incorrect domain."

The Sinhala translation "වැරදි වසමකි" literally translates to "incorrect circle" or "incorrect boundary". While it conveys a sense of incorrectness, 'domain' has a more specific meaning (e.g., internet domain, area of expertise). A more accurate translation would consider the context of 'domain'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternative translations like "වැරදි ප්‍රදේශය" (weradi pradesaya - incorrect area), "වැරදි ක්ෂේත්‍රය" (weradi kshethrnaya - incorrect field/area of expertise) or "අවලංගු වසම" (awalangu vasama - invalid domain) depending on the intended meaning of 'domain'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "域不正确" is technically correct, it's a very literal and slightly awkward translation of "Incorrect domain". A more natural and idiomatic translation would be something like "域名不正确" (míngyíng bù zhèngquè) or "域名错误" (míngyíng cuòwù).
